1.text: Make a lowercase T-shape with your sticks.

2.text: Attach the 2 sticks together with string and glue.

3.text: Make 1 to 2 in (2.5 to 5.1 cm) horizontal notches at the end of each stick.

4.text: Stretch the string around the frame.

5.text: Use a plastic bag, paper, or fabric that is 40 inches (100 cm) wide for the sail.

6.text: Lay the frame on the sail.

7.text: Outline the frame with a ruler.

8.text: Cut the diamond 2 inches (5.1 cm) wider than the outline.

9.text: Fold the edge of the sail over the frame and glue and tape it down.

11.text: Make a kite tail with a 6 ft (1.8 m) long piece of thick string.

12.text: Attach pieces of cloth or ribbon to the tail at 1 foot (0.30 m) intervals.

13.text: Decorate the kite with markers or colored paper.

14.text: Try out the kite in a spot with no trees or power lines.
